channel.title: Fabrice Popineau @ CentraleSupelec on
channel.description: Recent content in Fabrice Popineau @ CentraleSupelec on

item.title: Research
item.description: Topics My main research is devoted to the themes of the Lusis - CentraleSupélec artificial intelligence chair. The chair is developping three axes of research: credit card payments fraud detection, which extends to anomaly detection, algorithmic trading, causality in the context of the link between patient data and pathologies. Some of the underlying questions that I like to tackle are: Previously, my main research aimed at using artificial intelligence techniques to optimize human learning.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Publications My publications are spread onto three categories: Main My main publications in conferences and journals AIMA book The French translation of the book Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach (AIMA) by Stuart Russell and Peter Norvig TeX My contributions to the TeX community

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Current Courses since 2018 – Algorithmics and Complexity. 1st year course. CentraleSupélec, Paris-Saclay campus. since 2019 – Artificial Intelligence. 2nd year elective course. CentraleSupélec, Paris-Saclay campus. since 2020 – Introduction to Python for Data Science. MSc Data Sience and Business Analytics. CentraleSupélec & Essec, Paris-Saclay campus. Others : Research projects in the context of the research track of studies at CentraleSupélec. Year-long projects for 3rd year students in the context of the Lusis-CentraleSupélec chair.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence
item.description: The leading textbook about artificial intelligence by Stuart Russell and Peter Norvig has been translated to French. I supervised and participated to the French translation of the 2nd, 3rd and 4th editions together with Laurent Miclet. The 4th edition has benefited of careful and professional polishing and proofreading by Claire Cadet and the team in charge at Pearson France.

item.title: TeX related publications, presentations and seminars
item.description: Up to around 2005, I have devoted a great part of my research time to facilitating the dissemination of TeX, resulting in a few TeX related publications. I have maintained the TeXLive distribution of TeX for Windows for about 10 years. This was a demanding but rewarding collaborative work. I have (co-)organized the 2005 EuroTeX meeting in Pont-à-Mousson with Donald E. Knuth and Hermann Zapf as guests. The full proceedings of the conference are available online.
